climbs.name: Takin' A Ride
climbs.fa: January 2021- Dylan Thomas and Ryan Evans

content.description: Beautiful line up the SE Pillar of Mount Savage and well protected. Follow bolts up the leaning detached boulder to the well featured main face, knobby but quite steep. 9 bolts leads to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a two bolt anchor. The top is quite low angled so bring plenty of slings if top roping.
content.location: On the southeast arete of the SE Pillar on the lower tier. To access the anchors for top rope or for the walk off, scramble up the north face of the pillar with one or two third class moves. Do not try to access this scramble from the base of the summit rocks, as the deep gully that splits the lower tier makes it inaccessible.

climbs.name: I Want to Stand With You On a Mountain

content.description: Three styles all in one route! The lower third is the crux finger crack which can be easily lie backed. Middle third is an easy chimney. The upper third is a flared off width, but plenty of knobs and face holds make off width technique unneccessary.
content.protection: Small gear on the lower two thirds, then up to 6'' for the off width section up high. Two bolt anchor, accessible by a short downclimb but a belay is highly recommended to do so.
content.location: Left side of the lower tier up the deep obvious chimney that splits the lower cliff band.

content.description: Traverse behind the detached flake. Fun was to access the SE pillar. Don’t push to hard!
Follow the crack to a finger lock then up past a bolt protected mantle followed by micro cam protected faces moves to the top.
content.location: Go west from the summit or base of the other routes. 3rd class off the top.
